column4: I messed up my desktop enviroment using compiz. and now I only have  grey bar at the tome. I can only get into my home folder. Is it any way I can open a terminal from here so I can enter the compiz options?
tome = top
latest verion
everything i gone. I only have top bar with File, edit, view, go, bookmarks and help
So how do I open a terminal from the home folder? =p
alt-f2 does nothing.
this sucks massive amount of balls.
ctrl-alt-f1 will get you to a cli.
y.
Do you know how to enter the CompizFusion config from that terminal?
you can't open the compiz gui from there but you can log in and run run sudo unity --reset    then reboot the unity desktop should be set to stock.
actually I don't think you need the sudo just the unity --reset
allright lets see if its fixed.
still the same after reboot.

have you tried the other desktop options at the login window. Losing the desktop while tweaking compiz is quite common, but not a problem if you find a instructional web site, getting it back when broken is just as easy. This make take a few kicks to get it back.
compiz (unity) - Warn: unsupported internal format Segmentation fault.
what is the desktop yourt using?
your*
no idea
really.....not sure what to say.
I am in now. everything is back to normal. I do not know what I did but it works.
thx for help
no problem.
